bibl.title: The Reception of Greek Comedy in Rome.
bibl.note: Features a number of close readings, including the substantial passage (preserved on papyrus) of Menander's Dis Exapatôn (The Double Deceiver) which can, uniquely, be matched and compared with Plautus' appropriation at Bacchides 494-562.

bibl.title: The Cambridge Companion to Greek Comedy.

bibl.seg: 364 Menander C Dis Exapaton Menander D 365 Plautus
Michael Fontaine, The Reception of Greek Comedy in Rome.
Martin Revermann (ed.), The Cambridge Companion to Greek Comedy (Cambridge, 2014) pp. 404-423.

Features a number of close readings, including the substantial passage (preserved on papyrus) of Menander's Dis Exapatôn (The Double Deceiver) which can, uniquely, be matched and compared with Plautus' appropriation at Bacchides 494-562.
